timeline.author: KurtYoung

timeline.bodyText: how about using the target table name as the column name?
timeline.author: KurtYoung

replies.bodyText: I think "affected_rowcount" is necessary, how about "affected_rowcount_sink_table_name" ?
replies.author: godfreyhe

replies.bodyText: Seems too long to me, I think most users are aware of this bigint is representing the row count inserted into the table
replies.author: KurtYoung

replies.bodyText: in fact, the table qualified name may be long. in addition, we may need to add catalog name and database name to distinguish between tables with the same name.
replies.author: godfreyhe

replies.bodyText: Yes, that will be long. But if we don't show this, after we display some real row counts in the future, it would be impossible for users to understand the meaning.
replies.author: KurtYoung

replies.bodyText:
yes, if there are many sinks.
I will try to extract sink identifier names as the shortest form (also make sure them are unique) to reduce the length of field name
replies.author: godfreyhe

timeline.bodyText: Add this class in the pyflink/table/__init__.py file
timeline.author: hequn8128
timeline.diffHunk:

timeline.bodyText: It seems we don't need this. The class is not an abstract class in the Python side.
timeline.author: hequn8128
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,93 @@
+################################################################################
+#  Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+#  or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+#  distributed with this work for additional information
+#  regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+#  to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+#  "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+#  with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+#  Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+#  distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+#  WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+#  See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+# limitations under the License.
+################################################################################
+
+from abc import ABCMeta
+
+from pyflink.util.utils import to_j_explain_detail_arr
+
+__all__ = ['StatementSet']
+
+
+class StatementSet(object):
+    """
+    A StatementSet accepts DML statements or Tables,
+    the planner can optimize all added statements and Tables together
+    and then submit as one job.
+
+    .. note::
+    The added statements and Tables will be cleared
+    when calling the `execute` method.
+    """
+
+    __metaclass__ = ABCMeta

timeline.bodyText: I would prefer to keep it simple for now, just use the full identify is enough.
timeline.author: KurtYoung
